reports.suggestion_message:
to solve this problem, you can try the following approaches:

- update to a newer version to see if the issue has been fixed
  - bson v0.14.1 has the following newer versions available: 0.15.0, 1.0.0, 1.1.0-beta, 1.1.0, 1.2.0, 1.2.1, 1.2.2, 1.2.3, 1.2.4, 2.0.0-beta, 2.0.0-beta.1, 2.0.0-beta.2, 2.0.0-beta.3, 2.0.0, 2.0.1, 2.1.0-beta, 2.1.0, 2.2.0-beta, 2.2.0-beta.1, 2.2.0, 2.3.0, 2.4.0, 2.5.0, 2.6.0, 2.6.1, 2.7.0, 2.8.0, 2.8.1, 2.9.0, 2.10.0, 2.11.0, 2.12.0, 2.13.0, 2.14.0, 2.15.0, 3.0.0

- ensure the maintainers know of this problem (e.g. creating a bug report if needed)
or even helping with a fix (e.g. by creating a pull request)
  - bson@0.14.1
  - repository: <not found>
  - detailed warning command: `cargo report future-incompatibilities --id 1 --package bson@0.14.1`

- use your own version of the dependency with the `[patch]` section in `Cargo.toml`
For more information, see:
https://doc.rust-lang.org/cargo/reference/overriding-dependencies.html#the-patch-section

per_package.bson@0.14.1:
The package `bson v0.14.1` currently triggers the following future incompatibility lints:
> [1m[33mwarning[0m[1m: trailing semicolon in macro used in expression position[0m
>    [1m[94m--> [0m/home/yzzhao3/.cargo/registry/src/index.crates.io-1949cf8c6b5b557f/bson-0.14.1/src/macros.rs:212:54
>     [1m[94m|[0m
> [1m[94m212[0m [1m[94m|[0m           $crate::Bson::Document($crate::doc!{$($tt)+});
>     [1m[94m|[0m                                                        [1m[33m^[0m
>     [1m[94m|[0m
>    [1m[94m::: [0m/home/yzzhao3/.cargo/registry/src/index.crates.io-1949cf8c6b5b557f/bson-0.14.1/src/bson.rs:476:17
>     [1m[94m|[0m
> [1m[94m476[0m [1m[94m|[0m [1m[94m/[0m                 doc! {
> [1m[94m477[0m [1m[94m|[0m [1m[94m|[0m                     "$date": {
> [1m[94m478[0m [1m[94m|[0m [1m[94m|[0m                         "$numberLong" => (v.timestamp() * 1000) + v.nanosecond() as i64 / 1_000_000,
> [1m[94m479[0m [1m[94m|[0m [1m[94m|[0m                     }
> [1m[94m480[0m [1m[94m|[0m [1m[94m|[0m                 }
>     [1m[94m|[0m [1m[94m|_________________-[0m [1m[94min this macro invocation[0m
>     [1m[94m|[0m
>     [1m[94m= [0m[1mwarning[0m: this was previously accepted by the compiler but is being phased out; it will become a hard error in a future release!
>     [1m[94m= [0m[1mnote[0m: for more information, see issue #79813 <https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/79813>
>     [1m[94m= [0m[1mnote[0m: this warning originates in the macro `$crate::bson` which comes from the expansion of the macro `doc` (in Nightly builds, run with -Z macro-backtrace for more info)
>

reports.suggestion_message:
To solve this problem, you can try the following approaches:


- Some affected dependencies have newer versions available.
You may want to consider updating them to a newer version to see if the issue has been fixed.

bson v0.14.1 has the following newer versions available: 0.15.0, 1.0.0, 1.1.0-beta, 1.1.0, 1.2.0, 1.2.1, 1.2.2, 1.2.3, 1.2.4, 2.0.0-beta, 2.0.0-beta.1, 2.0.0-beta.2, 2.0.0-beta.3, 2.0.0, 2.0.1, 2.1.0-beta, 2.1.0, 2.2.0-beta, 2.2.0-beta.1, 2.2.0, 2.3.0, 2.4.0, 2.5.0, 2.6.0, 2.6.1, 2.7.0, 2.8.0, 2.8.1, 2.9.0, 2.10.0, 2.11.0, 2.12.0, 2.13.0, 2.14.0, 2.15.0, 3.0.0

- If the issue is not solved by updating the dependencies, a fix has to be
implemented by those dependencies. You can help with that by notifying the
maintainers of this problem (e.g. by creating a bug report) or by proposing a
fix to the maintainers (e.g. by creating a pull request):

  - bson@0.14.1
  - Repository: <not found>
  - Detailed warning command: `cargo report future-incompatibilities --id 2 --package bson@0.14.1`

- If waiting for an upstream fix is not an option, you can use the `[patch]`
section in `Cargo.toml` to use your own version of the dependency. For more
information, see:
https://doc.rust-lang.org/cargo/reference/overriding-dependencies.html#the-patch-section
